title: Spring force - ranking spring constant from graphs

content.question: A student uses a force probe to exert varying forces on the ends of vertical springs <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>. The student then sketches the magnitude of the applied force as a function of the length of the spring for each spring, as shown. Which of the following correctly compares the spring constants <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> of each spring?

choices.label: <math alttext="k sub B, is greater than k sub C, which is greater than k sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="k sub B, is greater than k sub A, which is greater than k sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="k sub C, is greater than k sub B, which is greater than k sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="k sub A, is greater than k sub B, which is greater than k sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="k sub A, is greater than k sub B, which is greater than k sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
